Usage_Based_TransactionObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Usage_Based_TransactionObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Usage_Based_TransactionObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Usage_Based_Transaction_Request_Referenc.description: Reference Usage Based Transaction for which data will be returned

description: This element content contains the Usage Based Transaction reference element used to return Usage Based Transaction by reference id.

Customer_ContractObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Customer_ContractObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Customer_ContractObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Usage_Based_Transaction_Request_Criteria.description: Contracts used as criteria for selecting Usage Based Transactions.

CustomerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

CustomerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

CustomerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Usage_Based_Transaction_Request_Criteria.description: Customers used as criteria for selecting Usage Based Transactions.
The start date used as criteria for selecting Usage Based Transactions.
The end date used as criteria for selecting Usage Based Transactions.

description: This element content contains the wrapper element for the list of criteria representing the Usage Based Transaction.

validation.validation: You can specify Customer Contracts or Customers but not both.

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: Element content containing Usage Based Transaction Response Filter element

Usage_Based_Transaction_Response_Group.description: Flag indicating if the Usage Based Transaction Reference data is to be included in the response

description: Element content containing Usage Based Transaction Response Group element
